document_data.Works:
The powerful wizard was credited for his creation of the well-known [[evocation]] [[spell]] ''[[Aganazzar's scorcher]]''. The fire spell was inscribed on the first page of the ''[[Tome of the Covenant]]'', and was distributed to his apprentices.<ref><ref>

Aganazzar also created the less well-known ''[[Aganazzar's amanuensis]]'' and ''[[Aganazzar's hurlgate]]'' spells.{{cite web |

He was said to be patient and spent countless hours teaching students about the nature of the [[Weave]].

History.Life:
The School of Wizardry was founded in [[457 DR]] by Aganazzar along with his fellow magic enthusiasts [[Ilyykur]], [[Presper]], and [[Grimwald]]. Here, he tutored students, in particular [[Aubayreer]] until [[479 DR]], when the student left to continue his research in [[Myth Drannor]].

The four founders went on to form an alliance of mages known as the Covenant to promote peace among the kingdoms of the [[North]], as well as to prepare them against conflicts with [[orc]]s. In [[1081 DR]], the [[Red Wizards of Thay]] attacked the School of Wizardry and killed Aganazzar.
History.Legacy: Some time after the death of Aganazzar, the Red Wizards got their hands on the tome detailing the spell he created. From then on, the spell became used all over [[Faer√ªn]], from novices to masters.
